channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: caps leaked, box failed, contents and box placed in tote and sent to QA CROSS REFERENCE TO ORIGINAL HESS REPORT # 122765 COMPLETED ON 2/19/2024 HOWEVER HAD TO BE CANCELED AND RESUBMITTED DUE TO ERROR. DescribePack: entire top of box denigrated, nothing left except small corner of top, DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in tote and sent to QA

item.title: Report X-2024021735
item.description:
Report X-2024021735

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet, damaged package was loaded into trailer at 61-HART, bound for 64-SWND. Package was unloaded from trailer and removed from workflow without loading onto delivery van. Package was brought to QA cage for inspection. Package was placed in a plastic tote. DescribePack: Plastic bottle has loose cap, leaked. Package fell on its side, promoting leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of corrosive liquid.

item.title: Report X-2024021795
item.description:
Report X-2024021795

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021795 SequenceEvent: Wet pkg was placed in a lined Hazmat bin and taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: Loose caps allowed liquid to leak from 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles wetting and contaminating the contents and carton causing the carton to rip and partially dissolve. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in Hazmat bin. 2. X-2024021797 SequenceEvent: Wet pkg placed in lined Haqmat bin and taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: Loose caps allowed liquid to leak from 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles wetting and contaminating the contents and carton causing the carton to rip and partially dissolve. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in bin.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet pkg was placed in an unlined plastic bin and taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: Loose cap and failed inner seal on 1 x 5 liters plastic bottle allowed liquid to leak wetting and contaminating the contents and carton causing the carton to rip on the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in bin.

item.title: Report X-2024021852
item.description:
Report X-2024021852

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was dropped causing damage to the metal container. Pkg was placed in a lined Hazmat bin and taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: The press fitted screw cap with pop up spout was damaged when the metal can was dropped which allowed liquid to leak wetting the container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in lined Hazmat bin.

item.title: Report X-2024021207
item.description:
Report X-2024021207

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was damaged and discovered at the destination/delivery terminal. A Damaged Package Report was filed that indicates 1 x 16 oz plastic bottle leaked and was discarded. Contents were then repacked and Return To Shipper. Contents were loosely packed in FedEx Ground repack box with no packing material to keep contents from moving during shipment. The wet leaking pkg with no Hazmat markings and no orientation arrows required for pkgs containing liquids was placed in an unlined unauthorized plastic bin and taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: Loose trigger spray heads in 3 x 16 ounces plastic bottles allowed liquid to leak staining and wetting the contents leaking through a thin plastic bag and wetting the repack box as well. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg was placed in a bin.

item.title: Report X-2024021415
item.description:
Report X-2024021415

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet and ripped pkg placed in plastic bin and taken to the HMPA upon arrival. DescribePack: Safety cap punctured actual cap and inner seal of 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle allowing liquid to leak wetting and contaminating the contents of the pkg. One inner pkg containing 6 x 17 ounces metal aerosol cans packed in inner package with Ltd Qty diamonds printed on packaging. No Hazmat markings or orientation arrows on outer carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in bin.
